com.aeonium.javafx.validation.annotations

Annotation Type FXValidation


  • @Documented
 @Target(value=FIELD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface FXValidation
    Use this annotation for applying custom validation to a control: Implement a custom validator class (derived from FXAbstractValidator) and assign it's class with the validation() attibute of this annotation.

    You may use the attribute applicableFor() to limit the use of your validator to a number of control classes.

    Author:
    Robert Rohm <r.rohm@aeonium-systems.de>

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.Class<? extends FXAbstractValidator> validation 

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.Class<? extends javafx.scene.control.Control>[] applicableFor
      Array containing the set of controls that this validation may be applied to.
      java.lang.String message 

    • Element Detail

      • validation

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends FXAbstractValidator> validation

      • applicableFor

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends javafx.scene.control.Control>[] applicableFor
        Array containing the set of controls that this validation may be applied to. Use an empty array for "any control". This is valid, since interpreting an empty array as "this validation cannot be applied to any control" would not make sense.
        Returns:
        List of all aplicable Control subtypes
        Default:
        {}

      • message

        public abstract java.lang.String message
        Default:
        "Validation failed"
